KH.content: khōra as abyss, mise en abyme, gaping hole, not exactly chaos or fright, but not Gaia, foundation, either > abyss in encyclopedic logic [of Timaeus], regulates all sites (lieux) on its edges (jobs in society, region, territory, country)
KH.linkedContent: khōra as abyss, mise en abyme, gaping hole, not exactly chaos or fright, but not Gaia, foundation, either > abyss in encyclopedic logic [of Timaeus], regulates all sites (lieux) on its edges (jobs in society, region, territory, country)

O.content: Hegel’s philosophical encyclopedia, last of its kind in history to deserve the name > encyclopedia is thoroughly theological in essence/origin (despite the so-called atheistic one)
O.linkedContent: Hegel’s philosophical encyclopedia, last of its kind in history to deserve the name > encyclopedia is thoroughly theological in essence/origin (despite the so-called atheistic one)

O.content: for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]

T.content: two types of mastery (phallocentrism, logocentrism): 1) hierarchy [Aristotle, Descartes, Kant, Husserl, Heidegger] 2) envelopment [Spinoza, Leibniz, Hegel] (whole in each part), system, encyclopedia, circle, homogeny
T.linkedContent: two types of mastery (phallocentrism, logocentrism): 1) hierarchy [Aristotle, Descartes, Kant, Husserl, Heidegger] 2) envelopment [Spinoza, Leibniz, Hegel] (whole in each part), system, encyclopedia, circle, homogeny

P.content: Hegel’s Lectures on Aesthetics: system of training for teaching and cycle of knowledge
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s Lectures on Aesthetics: system of training for teaching and cycle of knowledge

P.content: metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia
P.linkedContent: metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia

P.content: Hegel’s circles, each part of whole, a “circle returning to itself,” keeps tie of solidarity w/ others, through fecund backward and forward movement (Rückwärts, Vorwärts) [idea of beauty in philosophical encyclopedia]
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s circles, each part of whole, a “circle returning to itself,” keeps tie of solidarity w/ others, through fecund backward and forward movement (Rückwärts, Vorwärts) [idea of beauty in philosophical encyclopedia]

P.content: art: domesticated in this history of truth, onto-encyclopedic economy, the machinery of the pose (Setzung/Entgegensetzung)
P.linkedContent: art: domesticated in this history of truth, onto-encyclopedic economy, the machinery of the pose (Setzung/Entgegensetzung)

RM.content: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated”
RM.linkedContent: closure is not a circular limit (bordering homogenous field), but a more twisted (plus retorse) structure, another figure: “invaginated”

RM.content: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic
RM.linkedContent: representation of a linear & circular closure surrounding a homogenous space is a self-representation of philosophy in its onto-encyclopedic logic

WAP.content: onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university
WAP.linkedContent: onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university

WAP.content: a university is always the construction of a philosophy
WAP.linkedContent: a university is always the construction of a philosophy

WAP.content: paideia as auto-encyclopedia > teacher effaces himself so student can begin again [Condillac]
WAP.linkedContent: paideia as auto-encyclopedia > teacher effaces himself so student can begin again [Condillac]

WAP.content: philosophy is ontology, its paideia is an encyclopedia

double bind of techno-science (formalization)/philosophy (mother/natural tongue): 1) formalization of techno-science resists monolingual hegemony of philosophy as onto-encylopedia—science of sciences 2) philosophy can still point to dogmatic philosophemes in science
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of techno-science (formalization)/philosophy (mother/natural tongue): 1) formalization of techno-science resists monolingual hegemony of philosophy as onto-encylopedia—science of sciences 2) philosophy can still point to dogmatic philosophemes in science

WAP.content: onto-encylopedic universitas inseparable from a certain concept of the State; Cousin: “University is the State,” “public power brought to bear on the instruction of the young”
WAP.linkedContent: onto-encylopedic universitas inseparable from a certain concept of the State; Cousin: “University is the State,” “public power brought to bear on the instruction of the young”

WAP.content: Cousin: to teach is not a natural right, the professor of philosophy is a functionary of the moral order [for more on influence of Victor Cousin, cf. P p. 19]
WAP.linkedContent: Cousin: to teach is not a natural right, the professor of philosophy is a functionary of the moral order [for more on influence of Victor Cousin, cf. P p. 19]

WAP.content: Hegel’s presupposition of the Idea is linked to entire onto-encyclopedia, and thereby entire Universitas, which cannot be dissociated from the system
WAP.linkedContent: Hegel’s presupposition of the Idea is linked to entire onto-encyclopedia, and thereby entire Universitas, which cannot be dissociated from the system

WAP.content: Derrida now wonders whether Hegel’s philosophy itself demands that no texts [i.e. his “Report”] be minor [preface? not even a text?] > passage from minor to major is tautological, reproduces heterotautology of speculative proposition
WAP.linkedContent: Derrida now wonders whether Hegel’s philosophy itself demands that no texts [i.e. his “Report”] be minor [preface? not even a text?] > passage from minor to major is tautological, reproduces heterotautology of speculative proposition

WAP.content: Hegel’s system an immense school: auto-encylopedia of absolute spirit in absolute knowledge > never leave this school, mandatory instruction
WAP.linkedContent: Hegel’s system an immense school: auto-encylopedia of absolute spirit in absolute knowledge > never leave this school, mandatory instruction

WAP.content: Universitas: onto-, auto-encyclopedic circle of the State
WAP.linkedContent: Universitas: onto-, auto-encyclopedic circle of the State

EJQB.content: radical illisibilité belongs to the book, very possibility of it > such illegibility not an accomplice of lost (sought after) legibility, of a page not yet cut from divine encyclopedia
EJQB.linkedContent: radical illisibilité belongs to the book, very possibility of it > such illegibility not an accomplice of lost (sought after) legibility, of a page not yet cut from divine encyclopedia

TN.content: philosophers, meddlers who can’t keep their hands off anything, insatiable polymorphous perversity, imperious encyclopedism
TN.linkedContent: philosophers, meddlers who can’t keep their hands off anything, insatiable polymorphous perversity, imperious encyclopedism

BSi.content: if bêtise not an error (bad judgment) but hebetated (dulled) judgment, aptitude for wrong judgment, it could be there in absolute knowledge [stupidity of encyclopedic knowledge]
BSi.linkedContent: if bêtise not an error (bad judgment) but hebetated (dulled) judgment, aptitude for wrong judgment, it could be there in absolute knowledge [stupidity of encyclopedic knowledge]

OG.content: book as idea of totality, encyclopedia, requires external signified, is against writing and its aphoristic energy
OG.linkedContent: book as idea of totality, encyclopedia, requires external signified, is against writing and its aphoristic energy

OG.content: violence on both sides: logocentrism (book), deconstruction (text)

IF.content: [vis-à-vis Flaubert] philosophy as vast circulation, unending procession of received ideas > insofar as encyclopedia generates/preserves ideas, it carries w/in itself its own necrosis: idea always becoming-matter (from 1st instant) > hence stupidity of philosophy (easy to stereotype), hence impertinence of materialism & spiritualism
IF.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Flaubert] philosophy as vast circulation, unending procession of received ideas > insofar as encyclopedia generates/preserves ideas, it carries w/in itself its own necrosis: idea always becoming-matter (from 1st instant) > hence stupidity of philosophy (easy to stereotype), hence impertinence of materialism & spiritualism

EU.content: universitas has essential tie w/ logocentric, onto-encyclopedic system
EU.linkedContent: universitas has essential tie w/ logocentric, onto-encyclopedic system

EU.content: philosophy’s new relation w/ techno-scientific reason: coextensive immediacy w/ encyclopedia
EU.linkedContent: philosophy’s new relation w/ techno-scientific reason: coextensive immediacy w/ encyclopedia

EU.content: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)
EU.linkedContent: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)

EU.content: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment
EU.linkedContent: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment
